snippet: The death toll, if confirmed, would make the killings in the village of Tremseh the worst in a series of massacres that have convulsed Syria in the increasingly sectarian uprising against President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Syrian opposition activists say more than 200 people were killed in a Sunni village by government forces using tanks and helicopters, which, if confirmed, would be the worst in a series of massacres that have convulsed the nation in the increasingly sectarian uprising; Syrian government counters with report of a mass killing in the village, saying it was committed by armed terrorist groups.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and NEIL MacFARQUHAR
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Neil MacFarquhar from Beirut, Lebanon. Reporting was contributed by J. David Goodman from New York, Alan Cowell from London, Dalal Mawad from Beirut and Hwaida Saad from Antakya, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: The death toll, if confirmed, would make the killings in the village of Tremseh the worst in a series of massacres that have convulsed Syria in the increasingly sectarian uprising against President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.main: Massacre Reported in Syria as Security Council Meets
headline.print_headline: Massacre Reported in Syrian Village as U.N. Security Council Meets

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
